III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/4/23, two staff members restrained a youth causing bruising
to youth’s wrist, arm, and shoulder. Youth ran away from the
facility and went to the hospital where pictures were taken of the
injuries and appear consistent with the explanation.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant
I attempted to reach Complainant on 09/11/2023 and 09/26/2023
and did not receive a return call.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A at Whaley Children’s Center on 09/07/2023
with another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Youth A stated he and the other Zonta House youths had trouble
staying in their rooms for bedtime on 09/03/2023. Youth A stated
sometime between 8:30 pm to 10:00 pm Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 were cleaning out his room and he became agitated
when he saw his hoodie on the ground in the storage room. Youth
A stated this hoodie carried an emotional value. Youth A stated
Supervisor 1 pushed Youth A into the storage room and they
began to tug on the hoodie. Youth A stated Supervisor 2 entered
the storage room and assisted Supervisor 1. Youth A stated
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 restrained him in a standing two-
person hold and then to the ground on to his back and Staff
person 1 held his legs once Youth A obtained his hoodie. Youth A
stated he resisted and moved around in the restraint because he
was worried about the left side of his abdomen due to previous
pain in that area. Youth A stated he was given his inhaler and
water to drink after the restraint despite staff thinking he was lying
about needing it to get attention. Youth A stated he and Youth C
truanted to Hurley Hospital with their phone call logs shortly after
the restraint. Youth A stated staff shadowed them to the hospital
and later Supervisor 1 arrived at the hospital while Youth A was
evaluated. Youth A stated he returned to Zonta House after his
evaluation and now resides at another facility within Whaley
2

Children’s Center. Youth A stated he feels safe. Youth A was not
observed with any swelling or bruising. Youth A stated the bruise
marks on his arms and shoulder faded away and denied any pain.
I emailed Youth A’s foster care worker on 09/26/2023 requesting
contact for this investigation. Youth A’s foster care worker replied
by email with no additional information regarding this investigation.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B at Whaley Children’s Center on 09/05/2023
with another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Youth B stated Zonta House youths did not want to go to bed on
09/03/2023. Youth B stated Youth A wanted his girlfriend’s hoodie
to help him cope and Youth A pushed Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 to get his hoodie. Youth B stated Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 secured Youth A’s arms and Staff person 1 secured
Youth A’s legs. They restrained Youth A to the ground on his back
in the Zonta House main bedroom hallway. Youth B stated Youth
A moved around in the restraint and was released when he
calmed down. Youth B stated she got a hold of the hoodie and
found the note inside the hoodie that Youth A wanted. Youth B
stated she gave the note to Youth A before Youth A and Youth C
left Zonta House and headed to Hurley Hospital.
Youth C
I interviewed Youth C at Whaley Children’s Center on 09/20/2023
with another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Youth C stated Medical Aid was at Zonta House to check on and
clean Youth C’s self-harm cuts to her arm when Youth A’s
restraint occurred. Youth C stated Youth A was restrained by
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 when Youth A allegedly put his
hands on them to get his girlfriend’s hoodie. Youth C stated Youth
A moved around in the restraint and Youth C tried to help him, but
Supervisor 1 pushed Youth C and she punched back twice on
Supervisor 1’s arm. Youth C stated Medical Aid and Youth B
argued over the note in Youth B’s possession. Youth C stated she
gave a cup of water to Youth A when he started to have an
asthma attack after the restraint. Youth C stated she and Youth A
took their phone call logs from Supervisor 1 and went outside after
the restraint and left for Hurley Hospital. Youth C stated a staff
person shadowed them to Hurley Hospital. There were no new or
unhealed marks observed on Youth C’s arms. Youth C denied
thoughts of self-harm.
Supervisor 1
3

I interviewed Supervisor 1 at Whaley Children’s Center on
09/05/2023 with another Department of Health and Human
Service worker. Supervisor 1 stated he was at Zonta House for an
incident involving Youth C and noticed the other two youths not
complying with bedtime routine. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A said
he was waiting for another youth to return before going to bed.
Supervisor 1 stated he suspected Youth A was planning to truant.
Supervisor 1 stated Supervisor 2 started putting away shoes,
sweatshirts, and coats to deter truancies when Youth A jumped up
and said, “Better not be looking through my jacket (hoodie)” and
tried to get his hoodie. Supervisor 1 stated he was flipping Youth
A’s hoodie inside out to make sure vape pens or other contraband
were not in it when Youth A pulled at it. Supervisor 1 stated
Supervisor 2 assisted in freeing Supervisor 1’s arm from the
hoodie and Youth A hit Supervisor 1 and took the hoodie.
Supervisor 1 stated Youth A said, “Can’t find it” in reference to a
note and moved to hit Supervisor 2. Supervisor 1 states he and
Supervisor 2 each held one of Youth A’s arms in a two-person
hold and went to the ground in the hallway when Youth A resisted
and struggled in the hold. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was on his
back and Staff Person 1 held Youth A’s legs. Supervisor 1 stated
Youth C hit him when Youth A directed Youth C to do so.
Supervisor 1 stated either Youth B or Youth C obtained Youth A’s
hoodie and found a folded piece of a paper in it and this settled
Youth A down. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was given his inhaler
and water to drink after the restraint. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A
was not injured in the restraint, but complained his liver hurt during
the restraint. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A did not want to talk with
him after the restraint. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A and Youth C
left Zonta House and walked to Hurley Hospital as a staff person
shadowed them by foot. Supervisor 1 stated he went to Hurley
Hospital and stayed with Youth A and Youth C until they were
discharged back to Zonta House.
Supervisor 2
I interviewed Supervisor 2 at Whaley Children’s Center on
09/05/2023 with another Department of Health and Human
Service worker. Supervisor 2 stated she was at Zonta House for
Youth C when Youth A became distracted about something in his
hoodie. Supervisor 2 stated seeing Youth A pull on a hoodie that
Supervisor 1’s hand was twisted in. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A
flailed his arms and hit her and Supervisor 1. Supervisor 2 stated
she and Supervisor 1 secured Youth A’s arms and Youth A went
to the ground on his back. Supervisor 2 stated Staff Person 1
secured Youth A’s legs because Youth A struggled and kicked in
the restraint. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A was released when he
4

complained of stomach pain and settled down after a youth told
him a note was found in the hoodie. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A
laid on the ground and used his inhaler before getting up and
going outside. Supervisor 2 stated Youth C hit Supervisor 1 in the
head sometime during Youth A’s restraint. Supervisor 2 stated
Medical Aid called for assistance and law enforcement arrived
after Youth A was already released.
Staff Person 1
I interviewed Staff Person 1 at Whaley Children’s Center on
09/05/2023 with another Department of Health and Human
Service worker. Staff Person 1 stated Supervisor 1 and Supervisor
2 were cleaning out Youth A’s room on 09/03/2023 when Youth A
pulled on a hoodie while Supervisor 1 was flipping the hoodie right
side out. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A became upset that he
could not find a note in the hoodie. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A
pushed Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 and this led to a restraint.
Staff Person 1 stated Youth A was on his back while she held
Youth A’s legs and Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 held Youth A’s
arms. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A calmed down when one of
the youths got a hold of the hoodie and found the note. Staff
Person 1 stated Youth A was released from the restraint and
Medical Aid gave Youth A his inhaler and water.
Medical Aid
I interviewed Medical Aid at Whaley Children’s Center on
09/05/2023. Medical Aid stated she was at Zonta House on
09/03/2023 to evaluate and clean Youth C’s self-inflicted,
superficial cuts on her arm. Medical Aid stated during this time
Youth A became upset over a sweater (hoodie) when Supervisor
2 started cleaning out Youth A’s room. Medical Aid stated she
went to the hallway when assistance was called and saw Youth A
on the ground on his backside restrained by Supervisor 1,
Supervisor 2, and Staff Person 1. Medical Aid stated Youth B
picked up the hoodie and found the note inside it and Youth A
settled down. Medical Aid stated Youth A previously mentioned
not wanting anyone to read the note from his girlfriend, but
Medical Aid did not know the contents of the note. Medical Aid
stated Youth C maneuvered past her and Youth C hit Supervisor 1
during Youth A’s restraint. Medical Aid stated she gave Youth A
his inhaler after the restraint.
Video
Video footage of 09/03/2023 at 9:05 pm Zonta House’s main
bedroom hallway was reviewed on 09/07/2023. Video footage is
not available inside the storage room and video footage does not
5

record sound. It shows Youth A standing in the storage room
doorway pulling on a hoodie back and forth. Youth A obtains the
hoodie and searches for something inside. Youth A cries and
throws the hoodie on the ground. Supervisor 2 excitedly talks with
Youth A in the hallway. Supervisor 2 stands in the storage room
doorway when Youth A shoves himself against Supervisor 2 with
Supervisor 1 behind Supervisor 2. Youth A enters the room.
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 exit the storage room with Youth A
in a two-person hold. Youth A pulls forward in resistance and a
supine restraint occurs. Supervisor 1 holds Youth A’s right arm
and Supervisor 2 holds Youth A’s left arm and Staff Person 1
holds Youth A’s legs. Youth C walks around Medical Aid in the
hallway and tries to wrap an arm around Supervisor 1’s shoulder,
climb over him, and then hits him in the arm. Youth A moves
around on the ground trying to break free of the restraint. Youth B
is in the hallway and finds a white folded paper in the hoodie.
Youth A is released from the restraint at 9:21 pm. Youth A
receives his inhaler and a bottle of water at 9:27 pm. Youth C
gives the white folded paper to Youth A. Medical Aid stays with
Youth A until 9:40 pm.
Documentation
Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Staff Person 1, and Medical Aid wrote
incident reports. In summary, the incident reports state on
09/03/2023 at 9:10 pm during bedtime routine Youth A escalated.
Youth A’s hoodie was removed from his room due to his recent
truancies and to check for contraband. Youth A began to yell and
pull the sweatshirt from staff. Youth A began to shove and push
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 against the wall due to a note in
the hoodie and was restrained. Youth A called for Zonta House
youths to attack staff.
Hurley Hospital paperwork states Youth A was admitted on
09/04/2023 at 12:10 am and discharged on 09/04/2023 at 4:36
am. It states Youth A stated he wanted to get a hold of his legal
guardian. It states Youth A complained of marks on his body due
to a restraint over a hoodie. Hospital documented marks on Youth
A as follows: top of his right wrist, right shoulder and arm, and left
chest. It states Youth A has skin injuries that do not require
imaging or treatment. Youth A stated he felt safe to return to Zonta
House.
Employee files
• Supervisor 1 hired 07/06/2021. Supervisor 1 completed
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention restraint refresher on
04/12/2023.
6

• Supervisor 2 hired 02/10/2014. Supervisor 2 competed
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention restraint refresher on
04/26/2023.
• Staff Person 1 hired 08/14/2023. Staff person 1 completed
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention restraint training 08/15/2023
to 08/18/2023.
• Medical Aid hired 03/28/2022. Medical aid completed
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention restraint refresher
04/26/2023.
Tour Observation
I toured Zonta House on 09/07/2023 and viewed the hallway
where Youth A was restrained. The hallway is narrow. Standing in
the middle of the hallway with one’s arms stretched out to each
side, it would be possible to touch the hallway walls.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency
completed an investigation without findings.
Analysis Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, and Staff Person 1 restrained Youth A
on 09/03/2023. Youth A went to Hurley Hospital on his own accord
following his restraint. Hurley Hospital documented Youth A with
bruising on the top of his right wrist, right shoulder and arm, and
left chest. Youth A’s skin injuries were determined to not require
imaging or treatment. I interviewed Youth A on 09/07/2023 and
observed him without marks. Youth A stated the bruises faded
away and stated he was not in pain. Restraints are to be done free
of marks, injury, and pain, however, video review supports the
interviews that Youth A moved around and resisted the restraint. It
is found Youth A’s movement in the restraint contributed to his
bruising, which did not need medical attention. It is not found that
staff physically punished Youth A.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
R 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Video review showed Supervisor 2 excitedly talking to Youth A in
the hallway. Video does not include sound and Youth A did not
allege that Supervisor 2 yelled or threatened him. Best practice is
for staff to respond in a calm, firm manner in escalating situations.
7

Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & R 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically address all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff refused to allow the youth to call their mother/guardian.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant
I attempted to reach Complainant on 09/11/2023 and 09/26/2023
and did not receive a return call.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A at Whaley Children’s Center on 09/07/2023
with another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Youth A stated phone call logs are the youth’s property, but
Supervisor 1 wanted to keep hold of their phone call logs on
09/03/2023. Youth A stated he grabbed his and Youth C’s phone
call log from Supervisor 1 and they took their phone call logs to
Hurley Hospital. Youth A stated he needed the phone call log to
call his mother. Youth A stated the phone call logs indicate who
the youth is permitted to call and records whom the youth calls
and date of the call.
Youth C
I interviewed Youth C at Whaley Children’s Center on 09/20/2023
with another Department of Health and Human Service worker.
Youth C stated Youth A took Youth A and Youth C’s phone call
logs from Supervisor 1, who wanted the phone call logs to remain
at Zonta House. Youth C stated Youth A and Youth C wanted their
phone call logs to make phone calls at Hurley Hospital.
Documentation
During unannounced visits at Zonta House I have observed phone
call log sheets in a binder for staff to use to make and document
youth phone calls.
Another Department of Health and Human Service agency
completed an investigation without findings.
8

Analysis Youth A and Youth C stated needing their phone call logs on
09/03/2023 to make phone calls at Hurley Hospital. Neither youth
stated not being able to make phone calls at Zonta House.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A youth at Zonta House was physically restrained by three staff members after becoming agitated when staff were inspecting his personal hoodie. The youth subsequently went to the hospital, where bruising was documented, but the investigation concluded the restraint was not a physical punishment and that the injuries were caused by the youth's own resistance during the incident. The report also investigated an allegation that staff refused a youth's request to contact a guardian, but found no substantiation. The investigation concluded that no licensing violations were established in either case.
